intro: Rourea pseudobaccata, commonly known as the false rubber tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
